'''''Mythlore'' 134''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol37/iss2/ Volume 37, Issue 2]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].

==Contents==

====Articles====

* Reid, Robin Anne. "On the Shoulders of Gi(E)nts: The Joys of Bibliographic Scholarship and Fanzines in Tolkien Studies."
* DuPlessis, Nicole M. "On the Shoulders of Humphrey Carpenter: Reconsidering Biographical Representation and Scholarly Perception of Edith Tolkien."
* Inchbald, Guy W. B. "The Last Serialist: C.S. Lewis and J.W. Dunne."
* Chisholm, Chad. "Saruman as 'Sophist' or Sophist Foil? Tolkien’s Wizards and the Ethics of Persuasion."
* Montgomery, Abigail L. "Gunslinger Roland from Yeats’s Towers Came(?): A Little-Studied Influence on Stephen King’s Dark Tower Series."
* Croft, Janet Brennan. "'Auntie, What Ails Thee?': The Parzival Question in ''Orphan Black''."

====Features====

* Croft, Janet Brennan. Editorial.
* Croft, Janet Brennan. ''Mythlore'' at 50.
* Berube, Pierre H. An Unsourced Poem in Lewis’s ''Great Divorce''.
* Berman, Ruth. Narnian Stars.
* Croft, Janet Brennan. In Memoriam: Nancy-Lou Patterson.

====Reviews====

* ''Fairy Tale: A Very Short Introduction'' by Marina Warner. Reviewed by Barbara L. Prescott.
* ''The Inklings and King Arthur: J.R.R. Tolkien, Charles Williams, C.S. Lewis, and Owen Barfield on the Matter of Britain''. Ed. Sørina Higgins. Reviewed by Jared Lobdell.
* ''Tolkien, Self and Other: "This Queer Creature."'' by Jane Chance and Tolkien and Alterity. Eds. Christopher Vaccaro and Yvette Kisor. Reviewed by Jason Fisher.
* ''The Lion in the Waste Lane: Fearsome Redemption in the Works of C.S. Lewis, Dorothy L. Sayers, and T.S. Eliot'' by Janice Brown. Reviewed by James Stockton.
* ''Goddesses: Mysteries of the Feminine Divine'' by Joseph Campbell, Ed. Safron Rossi. Reviewed by Carl Badgley.
* ''"The Sweet and the Bitter": Death and Dying in J. R. R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings'' by Amy Amendt-Raduege. Reviewed by Laura Lee Smith.
* ''Fire and Snow: Climate Fiction from the Inklings to Game of Thrones'' by Marc DiPaolo. Reviewed by Kristine Larsen.
* ''The Great Tower of Elfland: The Mythopoeic Worldview of J.R.R Tolkien, C.S. Lewis, G.K. Chesterton, and George MacDonald'' by Zachary A. Rhone, foreword by Colin Duriez. Reviewed by Felicia Jean Steele.
* ''C.S. Lewis: A Very Short Introduction'' by James Como. Reviewed by Zachary A. Rhone.
* ''Pamela Colman Smith: The Untold Story'' by Stuart R. Kaplan with Mary K. Greer, Elizabeth Foley O'Connor, and Melinda Boyd Parsons. Reviewed by Emily E. Auger.
* ''Women Who Fly: Goddesses, Witches, Mystics, and Other Airborne Females'' by Serinity Young. Reviewed by Felicity Gilbert.
* ''The Place of the Lion and War in Heaven'' by Charles Williams. Reviewed by Janet Brennan Croft.
